newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Zimbabwe key index rises on heavyweights' gains.
newsitem.headline: Zimbabwe key index rises on heavyweights' gains.

text.p: Zimbabwean shares were quiet on Monday but the main industrial index rose 49.60 points to close at 10,437.40 on the back of gains in a number of key counters, brokers said.
"There was not much business across the market with 33 counters untraded. Despite this the index firmed through the 10,400 area on heavyweights gains," one broker commented, adding:
"The level of foreign activity was higher today with six foreign deals going through.

The day's advances were in pharmaceutical firm Caps and hotel giant Meikles both up 100 cents to 3,000 and 2,900 respectively, while bankers NMB put on 50 cents to 3,150, cement group Porthold added 40 cents to 1,950 and Apex gained 30 cents to 250.
Pork producer Colcom at 460, blue chip banking house Barclays at 3,250 and Alloys at 240 were all 20 cents firmer.

Minings saw more activity than of late but the secondary index there shed 67.58 points to 862.03, weighed down by losses in Ashanti Zimbabwe Depositories and nickel produer Bindura, down 10 cents at 110 and 175 cents at 625 respectively.
